data.title: Crash on startup when mod metadata files have bad permissions.
data.body:
We should be ignoring these instead.

```
Red Alert Mod at Version git-f6c607c
Date: 2017-03-04 16:15:54Z
Operating System: Linux (Unix 4.4.0.62)
Runtime Version: Mono 4.2.1 (Debian 4.2.1.102+dfsg2-7ubuntu4) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
Exception of type `System.UnauthorizedAccessException`: Access to the path "/home/paul/.openra/ModMetadata/ra-git-f6c607c.yaml" is denied.
  at System.IO.FileStream..ctor (System.String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, Boolean anonymous, FileOptions options) <0x7f940655d2c0 + 0x005ed> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.IO.FileStream..ctor (System.String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, System.String msgPath, Boolean bFromProxy, Boolean useLongPath, Boolean checkHost) <0x7f940655d210 + 0x0004d> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at (wrapper remoting-invoke-with-check) System.IO.FileStream:.ctor (string,System.IO.FileMode,System.IO.FileAccess,System.IO.FileShare,int,System.IO.FileOptions,string,bool,bool,bool)
  at System.IO.StreamWriter.CreateFile (System.String path, Boolean append, Boolean checkHost) <0x7f94063cfb80 + 0x00095> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.IO.StreamWriter..ctor (System.String path, Boolean append, System.Text.Encoding encoding, Int32 bufferSize, Boolean checkHost) <0x7f94063cf840 + 0x00073> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.IO.StreamWriter..ctor (System.String path, Boolean append, System.Text.Encoding encoding, Int32 bufferSize) <0x7f94063cf800 + 0x00035> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.IO.StreamWriter..ctor (System.String path) <0x7f94063cf750 + 0x0002a> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at (wrapper remoting-invoke-with-check) System.IO.StreamWriter:.ctor (string)
  at System.IO.File.WriteAllLines (System.String path, System.String[] contents) <0x7f940655b800 + 0x00033> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.ExternalMods.Register (OpenRA.Manifest mod) <0x400f85d0 + 0x0061a> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.InitializeMod (System.String mod, OpenRA.Arguments args) <0x400d4670 + 0x004df> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) <0x400766f0 + 0x00deb> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) <0x4004fa80 + 0x0003b> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) <0x4004ed60 + 0x000f7> in <filename unknown>:0 
```

data.title: Removed myself from the active developer list
data.body: as my commitment to the code has been pretty low recently and I don't see making a huge comeback. I am happy that new contributors are resuming what I started.

data.title: Load debug symbols for mods if they are loaded from the filesystem
data.body: This change is needed to debug mod code in monodevelop with sources instead of disassemly.

data.title: Change Turkish Flag outline to Blue
data.body:
It is an Allied Country, not Soviet.

It is not used in the mod itself, but chrome.yaml definitons are set so it can be used in modmaps, so what i said above applies.

data.title: tiberium trees are 1 cell higher than they should be on almost all maps
data.body:
did something happen when the maps were converted from older releases to newer ones?
i also heard that the TD maps format was changed or something like that? could that be the issue?

the reason i noticed that the trees changed their position is cause the cell below them is empty in Tiberium patches at the start of the game(and i don't remember seeing this in older releases)

data.title: could we get a V2 loading bar for when it is reloading the v2 rocket?
data.body:
i feel as if this feature would be nice to have due to the v2 taking so long to reload and being able to know when the v2 will be reloaded would help commanders when in battle
also maybe this feature could be added to other units like the telsla tank among other things?

data.title: Fix contrail gets rendered between loading in and loading out position
data.body:
Closes #12877.

Another option would be to create a new `ContrailRenderable` in `AddedToWorld`, right?

data.title: "Connection Failed" when trying to join custom map
data.body:
Hi, this bug has been existing for a while. if you try to join a custom map, sometimes there shows a "connection failed" error. This only happens in d2k.
![grafik](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16046997/23559831/94ef5cc6-0038-11e7-94d6-f3cfe93b43b3.png)


Through testing I could pinpoint it:
using the **PlayerResources** trait in the rules causes this bug.

to reproduce:
1. open two instances of OpenRA: A and B
2. choose [this map](http://resource.openra.net/maps/18574/) with A and try to join with B (->fail)
3. choose [this map](http://resource.openra.net/maps/19769/) with A and try to join with B (->success)

Only difference is PlayerResources removed in (3). 
Also tested in [these revisions](http://resource.openra.net/maps/19768/revisions/) for DefaultCash: and DefaultCashLocked (set-lock, lock-set, no-lock, no-set, nonzero values and values selectable in the dropdown menu (i.e 2500$ instead of 0$ )) but none showed success.

data.title: D2K - Add Ordos Mission 2a
data.body:
This is the first map that needs https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12809. For now as i said at there, i'm using `OnEnteredFootprint`.

Our reinforcements are moved to a transition tile, so it won't be blocked by buildings we build. It can be moved to original location when https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12464 is fixed.

data.title: Plug slot condition
data.body:
This is part of a bigger condition expression framework setup that I'm working on. I was hoping to get it into the next release because of planned changes to multipliers and `GainsExperience` which are already overhauled. This is just the bare framework for that with `Plug` slots. I would at least like the conditions for the Upgrade center renamed to match as an example of how they should be named for future compatibility with the dot condition expression operator.

If this is rejected from the next release, then just create a small PR renaming the plug conditions to plug{a,b}.{ioncannon,hunterseeker}

I picked a bad commit for rolling back my ConditionVariables branch. I thought a checked each commit, oh well.

A more up to date version is at https://github.com/atlimit8/OpenRA/tree/ConditionVariables.

data.title: NW and SW oriented stone bridge for large bodies
data.body:
I noticed that there were new assets added to the RA Temperate bridge set (the cute little vertical and horizontal ones with one specifically for infantry). 
Is there any chance we'll be seeing a northwest and southwest oriented stone bridge for large bodies of water any time soon?
I just was a quarter of the way done with a map when I discovered there wasn't a northwest oriented extended bridge so I tried to 'cheat' the system by faking an extended bridge. It turned out as well as I hoped.

![brg pls](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25542788/23538599/6d5f720e-ffa2-11e6-8305-b3724619bc92.png)

data.title: Lobby give admin

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
this being my first pull request to openra so hello everyone :)

this branch allows players connected to a dedicated server in multiplayer lobby to yield game admin privileges to other connected player, this is done by clicking on a button left to the "kick" button in players view, chosen icon for this button was "beacon" for cnc and letter P (Promote) for others mods,

caveats:
 - tweaked current interfaces a bit to distinguish between players Admin and Host property
 - works only for dedicated servers, does not work for local servers where one of the players is hosting a game, this is by design, since there would be a problem when host yielded admin rights to client and then left server, this leaves client with open server screen and unable to start multiplayer game, even though button becomes available since he is now game admin

data.title: [RA] Change WF Cost to $1650
data.body:
Following #12739, I suggest that the build time of the secondary MCV (first MCV produced out of the War Factory) should be normalized by reducing the cost of the WF to $1650 (8s build time reduction). 

The purpose of the 40s MCV in my mods was not to punish early expansions, but to discourage building MCVs en masse. I noted that a side effect of this change was that the pace of the game was much slower and that early, basepushing MCVs with tesla/turret camping was much stronger. After reviewing the replays, I've concluded that the extra 8s on the secondary MCV was to blame for much of this. 

The longer build time of the secondary MCV allowed players to place an extra barracks before they could expand. This caused an approximate 10-15% increased rate of infantry production, which caused the player's money to disappear more quickly. This enlarged gap between income and production has made Tesla / Turret camping with the secondary MCV more cost effective, as compared to the 32s MCV. With the increased rate of infantry production, the delayed income from the expansion, and the cost-efficiency of a large basepush, the games were stuck in a low-eco scenario and thus made the games heavily dependent on this secondary MCV base push. These games were tested with players of all calibers, and these effects were especially noticeable on smaller maps. 

I have been testing a $1600 WF with a $2500, 40s, 75 move speed MCV for nearly a month now with promising results. The WF change in particular realigns the scaling of economy relative to the scaling of infantry by enabling earlier harvester production to produce enough extra money to fend off a base push. The downside of this change is that the starting ore patches will dry up earlier, but in the case of basepushing, this is actually a positive change because you get to mine more of your money **before** the Tesla / Turret camping starts. In addition, this change could also pave the way to make high tech a more feasible option.

data.title: RA - Define Badger's cameo on the sequence file
data.body: Fixes #12870. Badger has a cameo in game files. I don't see a reason why it is not defined here.

data.title: Badger has no icon
data.body:
I wanted to train Badger bombers in a custom map so I made them buildable, but the game crashes on entering the aircraft-tab, because Badgers have no icon defined by default. I couldn't find where to add it to make it work for myself, but an official icon does exist: 

http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/cnc/images/5/54/RA1_Badger_Bomber_Icons.gif/revision/latest?cb=20120308043802

data.title: Add new lua files added with new D2K missions to OpenRA.sln
data.body: Harkonnen2b's files are also added so depends on #12832.

data.title: Further polish the arrakis tileset
data.body:
Depends on #12784.
Resolves the issues uncovered in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12784#issuecomment-282859641.

Apart from moving tiles to the "Bridge" category and fixing passability, this also changes two other things:
- I always found an extra category for just one tile (brick) quite annoying (as you had to change from basic to brick to basic unnecessarily). So I just removed that category, moving the tile to the "Basic" category.
- I noticed that the lower part of `383` is a part of `443` and `430` is just a part of the `474`. So I moved those two to the respective category.

data.title: [RA] Add/remove official maps 3.
data.body:
**Alter**:

- Behind the Veil 2: http://resource.openra.net/maps/17553/
- Northwest Passage: http://resource.openra.net/maps/16075/

New revisions uploaded by the authors and regarded as an improvement by the community. Added '2' for Behind the Veil as the map differs quite a bit from the first 2-player version.

data.title: Keyboard debouncing problem
data.body:
I didn't have this problem on Windows platforms but on my Linux machine, the game seems to get my input twice when I type anything. I tried changing my system keyboard settings for debouncing problems (repetition delay, speed) but the problem is probably with OpenRA, I think. Currently I'm on Plasma Desktop with Linux 4.9.8-1-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Mon Feb 6 12:59:40 CET 2017 x86_64 GNU/Linux. The game is installed via package, which is the latest stable release. (community/openra 20161019-1 [installed])

- Pressing esc opens up pause menu but another esc closes it immediately.
- Pressing z, x, c (sell, powerdown, repair) gets pressed twice that I cant sell/power down/repair with short cut keys.
- Key doesn't get pressed three times that I never get these functions to work by any chance.

Windows is my main platform and dev environment, not that urgent for me though. I wonder if other Linux users have similar problems -- I wonder if it is reproducible on some other Linux distros.

data.title: DisguiseToolTip and Tooltip tag name inconsistency
data.body: Second t in Tooltip, EditorOnlyTooltip and PowerTooltip are lowercase. In DisguiseToolTip it is uppercase.

data.title: [TS] Allow for air units that have different altitudes to pass freely through and occupy the same tiles.
data.body:
This is a concept I had though of previously when I was experimenting with giving different aircraft types different altitudes to reflect an abstraction on real functionality. Say for example a helicopter and a fighter jet, where the helicopter would have a much lower altitude than the jet. 

Currently even though these units travel with different altitudes, they bump into each other, which looks quite odd. For mods that use larger numbers of aircraft the chances of these collisions occurring increase.  

Now in the spirit of gauging the dev's interest in this, if this is something you would consider valuable and be willing to have functionality like this in the engine itself, I would be more than happy to look into it, implement it and create PR. I not, I'd be just as happy creating the specific functionality on a per mod basis.

data.title: Make AutoTargetIgnore upgradeable
data.body:
I know that adding more PRs to the milestone is not very helpful, sorry for that.
However I think that this is an easy fix (you could trick the soviet05 mission by selling the radar and thus making it impossible to fail the "defend the radar" objective) and not very hard to test.

Just nuke the borders of the base (not destroying the radar), and then spam the base with tesla coils. They should demolish everything other than the radar. Then sell them off and capture the radar. A small allied force will appear and attack the radar (which shows that it doesn't ignore autotargeting anymore).

data.title: Revise CaptureOrderTargeter a tiny bit
data.body: It looks to me like the hardocded `enter` cursor is still passed to the `UnitOrderTargeter` base class. So I fixed that (I don't know if it would break, but it looks suspicious to me) and did some other small touch ups, like caching the info class instead of querying it every time.
